title: Booking contracts for IBJJF Boston tournaments

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Booking contracts for IBJJF Boston tournaments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- booking contracts for upcoming IBJJF events
- contracts and reconciliation documents for past IBJJF events

The IBJJF is hosting a series of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu tournaments at the Reggie Lewis Track & Athletic Center: https://www.rcc.mass.edu/reggie-lewis/events-schedule.html#events/search/ibjjf. Please include all of these, as well as any events held in 2025.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Booking contracts for IBJJF Boston tournaments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Massachusetts Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 29, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RCC Response - Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Amico,

The Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. Chapter 66 & Chapter 4, Section 7(26)) provides that every person has a right to access public information.  This right of access includes the right to inspect or be furnished a copy of any public record within ten (10) business days following the receipt of a request.  A state agency is only required to provide records that are in existence and is not required to create a new record based on information in its custody to accommodate a specific request.

On January 29, 2026, Roxbury Community College received your public records request for:
"-booking contracts for upcoming IBJJF events
- contracts and reconciliation documents for past IBJJF events

The IBJJF is hosting a series of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu tournaments at the Reggie Lewis Track & Athletic Center: https://www.rcc.mass.edu/reggie-lewis/events-schedule.html#events/search/ibjjf. Please include all of these, as well as any events held in 2025."

The records responsive to your request are available for download from OneDrive:  [?Folder icon]  Records Request_Chris Amico<https://roxburycommunitycolleg798-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/jsmock_rcc_mass_edu/IgChnyfkrSrQT4cedXebCyOzAbE3H0nMexenfRbQqvAmOh4?e=8Nknkz>.

If you have any questions or I can be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me via email at jsmock@rcc.mass.edu<mailto:jsmock@rcc.mass.edu>.

Finally, if you wish to challenge the College's response, you may file a petition with the Supervisor of Records, Secretary of the Commonwealth, Public Records Division, McCormack Building, One Ashburton Place, Room 1719, Boston, MA 02108.  You may also seek judicial review by filing a civil action in Suffolk Superior Court.

Sincerely,
Jordan

Jordan Emily Smock
Associate Vice President & Records Access Officer

Roxbury Community College
1234 Columbus Avenue
Roxbury, MA 02120

Phone: 857-701-1234
Website: www.rcc.mass.edu<http://www.rcc.mass.edu/>

title: Department of Defense support for upcoming documentary "The Jump: Currahee to Normandy"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for upcoming documentary "The Jump: Currahee to Normandy"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the upcoming documentary  "The Jump: Currahee to Normandy." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Jump: Currahee to Normandy," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"The Jump: Currahee to Normandy" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Devyn Michaels/Johnathan Willette Homicide (Henderson Police Department)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Devyn Michaels/Johnathan Willette Homicide (Henderson Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Homicide of Johnathan Willette at the 200 block of Palo Duro Drive, Henderson, NV (HPD Case ref. if available):

911 call(s) reporting the body discovery.

Bodycam footage of first responding officers/EMS at crime scene (Aug 7, 2023) and body discovery.

Interrogation recordings of suspect Devyn Michaels.

Surveillance video from the Chevron gas station (Aug 6, 10:05 p.m., showing Michaels/Willette).

Security footage from the victim's home, surrounding areas, and neighbor cameras (10 p.m. Aug 6 - 2 a.m. Aug 7, capturing Nissan Armada and truck movements).

Notify of fees/redactions before processing; electronic delivery preferred. We do not need any written records—we want only audio and video.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Danielle D.

communications.subject: RE: City of Henderson case number efm 25-850530
communications.communication:
Hello Danielle, 
Due to the exceptionally high volume of records responsive
to your request—including thousands of files associated with this case—it has
taken our staff many hours to begin compiling the information. As a result, we
will require several additional weeks to prepare a complete cost estimate.
While our standard practice is to provide a quote within five business days,
the scope of this request far exceeds typical volume. We are committed to
fulfilling your request and ensuring timely access to contextual records such
as video and photographs; however, providing every single responsive file would
require extensive redaction work estimated at over $3,000 and several months of
processing. To expedite access, please let us know if you are agreeable to
limiting the scope of this request to files that will still provide you with
key details, photos, and video. 
If you agree, we will provide you with your cost by January
15th, 2025. Once the deposit is received, we do anticipate it will take
approximately 3–4 months to complete redactions, as we would need to work this
case into our regular caseload due to the amount of responsive items. This
approach would allow us to deliver records more quickly while maintaining
transparency. 

Thank you, 

Gina 

Reply to this email or use this link to add notes to the case: 
https://clients.comcate.com/myfeedbackView.php?view=2309674&id=90 

Public Records Officer 
Office hours: Monday - Thursday 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.

communications.subject: RE: City of Henderson case number efm 25-850530
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 
The records responsive to this request are too large to
attach to this Contact Henderson case and will be sent to you via Kiteworks,
the City’s secure file transfer system. You can expect two emails “Devyn
Michaels Folder 1 of 2, and Devyn Michaels Folder 2 of 2” as the files are
large and are unable to be sent in one email. 
The download is available for 14 days after it was sent to you.  Please let us know if you are unable to
download the files. 
I would suggest downloading from a laptop or personal
computer as using a phone does not work properly with such large files. 
Please be advised that the city redacted or withheld items
as appropriate to protect the non-trivial privacy interests of the victims and
their families. See Las Vegas Rev.-J., Inc. v. Las Vegas Metro. Police Dept.,
139 Nev. Adv. Op. 8 (2023); Clark Cnty. Sch. Dist. v. Las Vegas Review-Journal,
134 Nev. 700, 429 P.3d 313 (2018). In addition, the City has made redactions in
accordance with a court?issued seal order and to protect personal identifying
information (NRS 239.0105). 
Also be advised that the 911 Audio Call request was past our
retentions standards and therefore cannot be released. 
Our HPD 125 Records Dissemination Notification will also be available in Kiteworks. 
We thank you for your patience in this matter. 
***This request was made by a previous customer and therefore there will be no charge for this request*** 
This communication completes your request, and this matter
is now resolved. 
Respectfully. 

Reply to this email or use this link to add notes to the case: 
https://clients.comcate.com/myfeedbackView.php?view=2309674&id=90

title: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Morgan County Clerk and Recorder's Office)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Morgan County Clerk and Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast in Morgan County that is generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

Kevin Strauch

title: Military equipment

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Military equipment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

An inventory of all military equipment held by the department as of the date of fulfillment of this request. The request includes but is not limited to: 

(1) Unmanned, remotely piloted, powered aerial or ground vehicles.
(2) Mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles or armored personnel carriers. However, police versions of standard consumer vehicles are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(3) High mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles (HMMWV), commonly referred to as Humvees, two and one-half-ton trucks, five-ton trucks, or wheeled vehicles that have a breaching or entry apparatus attached. However, unarmored all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and motorized dirt bikes are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(4) Tracked armored vehicles that provide ballistic protection to their occupants and utilize a tracked system instead of wheels for forward motion.
(5) Command and control vehicles that are either built or modified to facilitate the operational control and direction of public safety units.
(6) Weaponized aircraft, vessels, or vehicles of any kind.
(7) Battering rams, slugs, and breaching apparatuses that are explosive in nature. However, items designed to remove a lock, such as bolt cutters, or a handheld ram designed to be operated by one person, are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(8) Firearms of .50 caliber or greater.
(9) Ammunition of .50 caliber or greater.
(10) Specialized firearms and ammunition of less than .50 caliber, including assault weapons as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code.
(11) Any firearm or firearm accessory that is designed to launch explosive projectiles.
(12) “Flashbang” grenades and explosive breaching tools, “tear gas,” and “pepper balls,” excluding standard, service-issued handheld pepper spray.
(13) Taser Shockwave, microwave weapons, water cannons, and the Long Range Acoustic Device (LRAD).
(14) The following projectile launch platforms and their associated munitions: 40mm projectile launchers, “bean bag,” rubber bullet, and specialty impact munition (SIM) weapons.
(15) Any other military equipment purchased by/for or transferred to the department. 

Requested components of the inventory:
The inventory should include the manufacturer, model number, quantity, initial costs of obtaining the equipment, and estimated annual costs of maintaining the equipment of each type of equipment, where "type" means each item shares the same manufacturer model number. 

The inventory should also specify under which program the equipment was obtained if applicable, including but not limited to the 1033 Program, the 1122 Program, the US Department of Homeland Security Grant Program, US Department of Justice’s Justice Assistant Grant Program, DOJ Equitable Sharing Program, US Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund’s Equitable Sharing Program, and The General Services Administration Federal Surplus Personal Property Donation program.  

I am also requesting a list of all military inventory that has gone missing in 2024 and 2025. 

I am a journalist employed by the news outlet The American Prospect and I am requesting a waiver of all fees. The disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the tools available to the department to maintain safety and order, and protect against attacks from both domestic and outside sources.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitney Wimbish

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Parish sheriff office- Public records request- Cameron Oliver
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Good day.
 I hope you are doing well. 
I am requesting the following records from your agency. 
Can you please provide a list of deputies currently employed by the sheriff office- by name and rank.
 Also, by District/time period. 
Drug crimes possession of all illegal drugs. 
I want a list of the suspects'  drugs charges and the deputy  who made the arrest.
 I want crime data on this crime from the years 2022-2025.
 Also, a list of the most frequent crimes your community faces.
 
Let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 

I look forward to hearing from you. 
Thank you for your time and consideration. 
Take care and be well.
 

Best regards,
 Cameron Oliver
 904-489-9118
 oliverkidsjax@gmail.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cameron John Oliver

title: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Routt County Clerk and Recorder's Office)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Routt County Clerk and Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast in Routt County that is generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

Thank you,


Jenny Thomas

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Jefferson County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Jefferson County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe
See the attached response and invoice.

title: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

1. All departmental or municipal policies regarding communication and information sharing between departmental officers or employees and federal agents/agencies within the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) or the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including but not limited to the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The records request includes, but is not limited to, policies regarding: 

A. Fingerprint and other data sharing, 

B. ICE detainer requests,   

C. Compliance with federal immigration enforcement efforts, including guidance or policies around when communication with ICE officers is allowed, and 

D. Communicating with federal immigration enforcement officers. 

This request covers any policies that are currently in effect or that have been in effect at any point on or after January 20, 2025. 

2. The five most recent communications (e.g., emails, text messages, call logs or transcripts, or otherwise) between a departmental officer or employee and a federal DHS or ICE employee concerning immigration matters. In addition, I request all records related to these communications, including, but not limited to, any records indicating that the department was made aware of the communications, discussions of their content or implications, evaluations them for compliance with departmental or other city policies, identification or acknowledgement of any potential policy violations, and any internal responses, disciplinary actions, or follow-up measures resulting from these communications. 

3. All records relating to incidents, if any, from January 20, 2025, to the day this request is responded to, in which an individual was taken from the department’s custody directly into ICE custody. For each incident, the records request includes, but is not limited to, booking and transfer records, communications with ICE or other federal agencies, internal documentation or discussion of the transfer, and internal notes, memos, or documentation referencing communication with DHS or ICE.

For each request, I am not seeking identifying information, and I will accept anonymized or redacted data as necessary to protect identities. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff 

Joshuadankoff@cfjj.org  

Director of Strategic Initiatives 

Citizens for Juvenile Justice  

(submitted via MuckRock platform)

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities
communications.communication:
Dear Joshua Dankoff,

Attached are the records you requested which includes our Mutual Aid Policy and 5 most recent email communications. With regards to request #3, there have been no individuals taken from the department’s custody directly into ICE custody.

Sincerely,

John Sanchioni

title: Maryland DPSCS Adult Room and Board + Medical Copay Policy

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Maryland DPSCS Adult Room and Board + Medical Copay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical copays and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding total fees collected from inmates for medical copays and room and board fees from 2020-2024. Please include the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed this past calendar year. Please also include the total amount of room and board fees collected through the work-release program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

title: Public Records Request – Arrest of Robert Jerry Lawrence on June 19, 2025

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Arrest of Robert Jerry Lawrence on June 19, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of all public records related to the arrest of Robert Jerry Lawrence (DOB: 03/11/1980), which occurred on June 19, 2025, in Leon County, Florida. Specifically, I am seeking incident reports, arrest reports, probable cause affidavits, body-worn camera footage, 911 call recordings, and any supplemental materials connected to this case. Mr. Lawrence was charged with (1) Attempted Homicide – Specific Felony Commit Act Could Cause Death (Statute: 782.051 1) and (2) Resisting Officer Without Violence (Statute: 843.02), with a total bond of $500. Please include all responsive documents, video, and audio records in your possession regarding this arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Baxter Price

 Louise Turner (Badge ID: 1212) from Tallahassee Police Dept (https://TallahasseePD.evidence.com) has sent you a link to download evidence on Evidence.com. title: Booking contract for IBJJF 2025 Crown

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF 2025 Crown
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Booking contracts and reconciliation documents for the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation 2025 Crown, held at the Walter Pyramid on Nov. 23, 2025. Please include final ticket sales and event costs, if available.

The event is referenced on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/p/DRLUqyWDdDz/) and on the IBJJF website (https://crownibjjf.com/).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

communications.subject: 25-101:  RE: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF 2025 Crown
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Amico,

We received your November 19, 2025, Public Records Act request for the following records: Booking contracts and reconciliation documents for the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation 2025 Crown, held at the Walter Pyramid on Nov. 23, 2025. Including final ticket sales and event costs, if available.
CSU has conducted a reasonable search for these records under California Government Code §7922.535 and has determined that your request, either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public records.  CSU will make available to you any that are public.

Records subject to the following exemptions will be withheld or redacted as appropriate:  Deliberative Process. Records that reflect the deliberative, decision-making process of the CSU, which often involves multiple individuals, who need to converse about issues candidly. Cal. Govt. Code §7922.000; Times Mirror Co. v. Superior Court (1991) 53 Cal.3d 1325; Montrose Chemical Corporation of California v. Train (D.DC 1982) 491 F.2d 63; Rogers v. Superior Court (1993) 19 Cal. App.4th 469.

We will let you know when we have gathered all the records.  It will be necessary to redact from them any personal and otherwise privileged information before they can be made available to you.  CSU estimates the records will be available January 24, 2026.

If you wish to inspect the records at CSULB, you may contact me to schedule a mutually convenient date and time.  If you wish to receive copies instead, CSU may charge the direct cost of duplication (20 cents per page).  Once the records are located, we will advise you as to the exact number of pages upon which any charge will be based.  We will require full payment before we begin the redaction and duplication process. The decision that records are exempt and will not be disclosed was made by the Records Access Officer at CSULB, Jamarr Johnson.
Regards,

Jamarr Johnson, CCSA
Director of Audit, Public Records & Special Projects
California State University, Long Beach
1250 Bellflower Blvd, BH 320
Long Beach, CA 90840
(562) 985-6033
[csuLB-long]

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF World Championships
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Booking contracts and reconciliation documents for the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation World Championships, held at the Walter Pyramid from May 29 to June 1, 2025. Please include final ticket sales and event costs, if available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF World Championships
communications.communication:

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: PRA 24-164:  RE: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF World Championships
communications.communication:
Dear Chis Amico -

We received your June 3, 2025, Public Records Act request for the following records: Booking contract for IBJJF World Championships.

CSU has conducted a reasonable search for these records under California Government Code §7922.535 and has determined that your request, either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public records.  CSU will make available to you any that are public.  Records subject to the following exemptions will be withheld or redacted as appropriate:

Records that reflect the deliberative, decision-making process of the CSU, which often involves multiple individuals, who need to converse about issues candidly. Cal. Govt. Code §7922.000; Times Mirror Co. v. Superior Court (1991) 53 Cal.3d 1325; Montrose Chemical Corporation of California v. Train (D.DC 1982) 491 F.2d 63; Rogers v. Superior Court (1993) 19 Cal. App.4th 469.

We will let you know when we have gathered all the records.  It will be necessary to redact from them any personal and otherwise privileged information before they can be made available to you.  CSU estimates the records will be available by July 25, 2025.

If you wish to inspect the records at CSULB, you may contact me to schedule a mutually convenient date and time.  If you wish to receive copies instead, CSU may charge the direct cost of duplication (20 cents per page).  Once the records are located, we will advise you as to the exact number of pages upon which any charge will be based.  We will require full payment before we begin the redaction and duplication process.
Regards,

Jamarr Johnson, CCSA
Director of Audit, Public Records & Special Projects
California State University, Long Beach
1250 Bellflower Blvd, BH 320
Long Beach, CA 90840
(562) 985-6033
[csuLB-long]

title: FlockSafety Emails 12-2025 (Lincolnwood Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FlockSafety Emails 12-2025 (Lincolnwood Police Department)
communications.communication:
To the FOIA Officer of Lincolnwood Police Department,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

Copies of all emails received by your agency from any sender email address containing the domain @flocksafety.com between 12/1/2025 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

This request includes but is not limited to:

1. Emails received by any employee official or representative of Lincolnwood Police Department using an agency issued email account
2. All attachments included with those emails
3. Related metadata sufficient to identify sender recipient (To:, CC:, BCC:), date and time of receipt, and subject line

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the case of any applicable fees, it is requested that an estimate of the total charges be provided prior to fulfilling this request. The preferred method of receipt is through electronic delivery.

Your assistance and cooperation in this matter are greatly appreciated. A response within 5 business days, as the statute requires, is anticipated.

With thanks,

David S. (he/him/his), Lucy Parsons Labs

title: Child care data request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Child care data request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Information related to all child care providers in Illinois since 2020. Specifically, the following information at the child care provider-month level, as it is available, from January 2020 to present:

1) Provider name and/or license ID
2) Address
3) Licensed capacity each month
4) Number of children receiving Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) each month

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Child care data request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Illinois Freedom of Information Act. request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 21, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: 26-FTS-8562 Pepin - Extension
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) received your request for records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) on January 22, 2026.  Your request seeks the following:


                Information related to all child care providers in Illinois since 2020. Specifically, the following information at the child care provider-month level, as it is available, from January 2020 to present:

1) Provider name and/or license ID
2) Address
3) Licensed capacity each month
4) Number of children receiving Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) each month

Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to five business days. 5 ILCS 140/3(e).  As such, the Department is extending the time to respond to your request by five business days on one or more of the following bases:


  *   The requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records;
  *   The request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records;
  *   The requested records have not been located in the course of a routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them;
  *   The requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; and
  *   The request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by FOIA without unduly burdening or interfering with the operation of the public body.

The Department will respond to your request on or before February 5, 2026.  Thank you for your patience and interest in the Illinois Department of Human Services.

Sincerely,

Sean Reddington (he/him/his)
Associate General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel
Illinois Department of Human Services
Email: DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov<mailto:DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov>

[IDHS Illinois Department of Human Services]



State of Illinois - CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The information contained in this communication is confidential, may be attorney-client privileged or attorney work product, may constitute inside information or internal deliberative staff communication, and is intended only for the use of the addressee. Unauthorized use, disclosure or copying of this communication or any part thereof is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately by return e-mail and destroy this communication and all copies thereof, including all attachments. Receipt by an unintended recipient does not waive attorney-client privilege, attorney work product privilege, or any other exemption from disclosure.

communications.subject: RE: 26-FTS-8562 Pepin - Extension
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin:

The Illinois Department of Human Services is still processing your request. Accordingly, the Department is requesting an additional five business day extension, which is permissible under Section 3(e) of FOIA.  5 ILCS 140/3(e).

Under the new deadline, the Department will respond on or before February 12, 2026 .  If you do not agree to this extension, please contact me at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Sean Reddington (he/him/his)
Associate General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel
Illinois Department of Human Services
Email: DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov<mailto:DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov>

[IDHS Illinois Department of Human Services]

files.title: image001
files.source: Department of Human Services, Illinois

communications.subject: 26-FTS-8562 Pepin - Response
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin:

The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) received your request for records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) on January 21, 2026.  Your request seeks the following:

                Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Information related to all child care providers in Illinois since 2020. Specifically, the following information at the child care provider-month level, as it is available, from January 2020 to present:

1) Provider name and/or license ID
2) Address
3) Licensed capacity each month
4) Number of children receiving Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) each month

Attached please find records responsive to your request.
Please note, the Department is prohibited from releasing information that would tend to identify an individual as a recipient of Child Care Assistance Program services under the Illinois Public Aid Code. 305 ILCS 5/11-9.  As a result, the Department did not include in-home childcare providers on the attached spreadsheet listing the Name/Address/Capacity information pursuant to Section 7(1)(a) of FOIA, which provides an exemption for information that is prohibited from release under State or federal law. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a).

Please note that the spreadsheet listing the number of children receiving CCAP each month includes counts from all provider types, including in-home providers.

To the extent you consider this response to be an improper denial of your FOIA request, you have a right to seek review by writing to the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the following address:

Public Access Counselor
Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street
Springfield, Illinois 62706
Fax: 217-782-1396
E-Mail: Public.Access@ilag.gov<mailto:Public.Access@ilag.gov>

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this response when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. You also have the right to seek judicial review of this response. 5 ILCS 140/11.

Thank you for your interest in the Illinois Department of Human Services.

Sincerely,

Sean Reddington (he/him/his)
Associate General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel
Illinois Department of Human Services
Email: DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov<mailto:DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov>

[IDHS Illinois Department of Human Services]

title: Alexandria VA

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandria VA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request the contract that the district entered into with a vendor for the stop arm camera pilot (50 buses). 

Additionally any applicable intergovernmental agreements with the City of Alexandria and/or the police department for the enforcement of school bus stop arm camera violations. 

Lastly, any records related to the procurement of the vendor stop-arm camera contract.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Jon Smith.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Monroe County 4
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:

https://wsvn.com/news/local/florida/new-york-man-arrested-for-dui-and-drug-possession-after-dancing-naked-on-us-1-in-florida-keys-deputies-say/

Exact date of incident: March 5, 2025

Names of parties involved: Timothy Mahoney


I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.


I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.


Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.

Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #PRR-6018-2025
communications.communication:
Dear Records Department,

Thank you for providing the video files related to my request.

However, after reviewing the materials received, I noticed that the most important footage appears to be missing. Specifically, the **first responding officer’s body-worn camera video** and the corresponding in-car/dash camera recording were not included.

The footage provided does not include the responding officer’s primary bodycam recording of the initial contact and arrest, which is essential to the request and appears to be listed in the invoice/records description.

Could you please review this matter and provide the missing files, or advise whether they were withheld, unavailable, or omitted in error?

Thank you for your assistance, and I appreciate your help in resolving this issue.

Best regards,
George Smith

[1]: https://wsvn.com/news/local/florida/new-york-man-arrested-for-dui-and-drug-possession-after-dancing-naked-on-us-1-in-florida-keys-deputies-say/ "New York Man arrested for DUI and drug possession after dancing naked on US 1 in Florida Keys, deputies say - WSVN 7News | Miami News, Weather, Sports | Fort Lauderdale"

title: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Montana Freedom of Information Act Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Montana Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: request for data on sex offender civil commitment

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: request for data on sex offender civil commitment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the number of sex offenders ("sexually violent predators") who are in civil detention or civil commitment under the Sexually Violent Predator Act (SVPA) in New Jersey. Specifically, I request the following data as of the most recent date available:
1) the total number of people civilly committed in New Jersey by sex for sex offenses; and,
2) the number of people civilly detained in New Jersey by sex for sex offenses.
If this data is not available by sex, I request the total numbers regardless of sex. If this data is held by another state agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Widra

communications.subject: Mayor's Office :: C241086-092625
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on September 26, 2025 and is appended below. Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your email contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center emails to your Inbox.  
 
The reference number for this request is C241086-092625. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 193726-75375537@requests.muckrock.com  
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password

To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C241086-092625. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C241086-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request.

title: PSC Enforcement Actions

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: PSC Enforcement Actions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Enforcement actions, penalties, fines, or corrective orders issued against Central Hudson Gas & Electric Corp. (2019-present), including the nature of the violation, dollar amounts, and resolution status.

Settlement agreements or consent orders between the PSC/DPS and Central Hudson (2019-present).

Records of customer refunds, credits, or remediation payments Central Hudson has been required or agreed to provide as a result of PSC action, complaint resolution, or billing error corrections—including aggregate totals and the nature of the underlying issue.

Audio/video recordings of any PSC hearings, proceedings, or public meetings related to the above enforcement matters.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

EJ Fox

title: Angel Leann Salazar

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Angel Leann Salazar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am respectfully requesting access to the following records related to Angel Leann Salazar (ID #100278265), currently held at the Bernalillo Metropolitan Detention Center, in connection with her murder case.

Requested Records (Primary):

The full custodial interrogation video recording(s) of Angel Leann Salazar conducted by law enforcement in relation to her murder charge.

Optional (only if immediately available without significant delay or cost):

Final arrest footage (bodycam, dashcam, or surveillance, if applicable).

Arrest report.

Up to five photographs directly related to the arrest.

Conditions and Clarifications:

If no interrogation video footage exists, please cancel this request and do not process or release any additional materials.

If the footage has already been released publicly, I request an unredacted copy; otherwise, I will accept a redacted version as needed for compliance.

Digital delivery is preferred (via email or secure file link).

Fee Waiver Request:
This request is made for educational and transparency purposes in the public interest. I respectfully request that any associated fees be waived in accordance with the public access provisions of the New Mexico IPRA.

Thank you for your time and assistance. Please confirm receipt of this request and notify me of any costs or expected timeframes before processing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dwayne Bishop

communications.subject: [Invoice Created] City of Albuquerque public records request #25-16012
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ An invoice has been created for record request #25-16012. Hello: Your IPRA request dated 10/30/25, requests video(s) stored in the Evidence.com/Axon platform, such as lapel video or other surveillance video. An advance fee of $1.00 per video, is required for all requests seeking videos pursuant to 14-2-9(C)(1). We will require advance payment for your public records request. Our office located 6 videos associated with your request, therefore, your advance payment for the video(s) will be $6. Please know that this is just the advance payment for the video(s), there may be additional fees associated with your request. You will have 5-days to pay this fee, once the payment is received and processed we will begin processing your records request. If you do not pay this fee, your request will be closed. Payment can be made online via the NextRequest portal, or you can mail your payment to the address below. Payment may also be made in-person in our office with exact cash, company check or money order, payable to “City of Albuquerque.” For payments by mail, please provide a copy of the attached invoice. Office of the City Clerk 600 2nd St. NW, 6th Floor Albuquerque, NM 87102 ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Albuquerque.

title: Kentucky HHS response

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky HHS response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Office of the Inspector General Division of Health Care :: H000010-011426
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
Thank you for your interest in open records of Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services. Your Office of the Inspector General Division of Health Care request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Kentucky Open Records Act—KRS 61.870 to KRS 61.884. Your request was received in this office on 1/14/2026 and given the reference number H000010-011426 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf. 

I also request internal communications between any Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed. 

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ileana Garnand 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the records you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. Pursuant to KRS 61.880(1), the Cabinet has five (5) business days from receipt of your request to respond. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The Kentucky Open Records Act does not require public agencies to create new records, to provide or compile information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when the Cabinet responds to your request. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Open Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT-2BnpR4ed5y5dM62QTWI-2Fwbtbnwp1BB8X0i5Km3oDLPIawyZl9THiAOkllK5gn5SfQ-3D-3DPeGZ_lZFtByWRbdYvxdCz9CWuxN-2F31TxGE8e6chiAz-2FWFXJhvIv1ZsWbkMe1Sz7am0gt7770-2FG-2F1M03wGe3cckFL6LIIJ8ucYElqYhquEY-2FyGIC2tLl69gy3UbfnBnDWQph0r1MtAd67YqfL1rdFQu9ml-2FAZ2z-2Bh8g2fBVCRuDSOK4CnU8NzgK-2BAVv-2Ba6utDdo6TSnQTLcRrDyye9qF3lXRJBCyAlAFtBoR99072ImZ78D4D4ifT-2FSP-2Fd9tWff-2BzoHIJF7HMu7wBWoKZrcs7falW1lYvhkc3fbSKHvBRQrslXu8Y0mXM9S0FvuYg3JDoDvPbtm8RJVQoCXBe6NOR8MaRsviX748ck5jfYuclEC1Fm23Ga-2B1pgQlSr7wSaYazqvksD)

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Office of the Inspector General Division of Health Care of January 14, 2026, Reference # H000010-011426 Dear Ileana Garnand, The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services received an open records request from you on January 14, 2026. Your request mentioned: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf. 

I also request internal communications between any Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed. 

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ileana Garnand Pursuant to KRS 61.872(5), the records you have requested are not readily available because the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services is having to manually search its files and records database for responsive records. The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services is searching for responsive records and will review any responsive records for compliance with the Kentucky Open Records Act. The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services will need until February 5, 2026, to respond to your request. For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Natalie Nelson 
Office of Legal Services (OLS) Information Regarding Your Right to Appeal 
If you wish to appeal this decision, you may do so by filing a complaint with the Office of the Attorney General, Open Records/Open Meetings, The Capitol, 700 Capitol Avenue, Suite 118, Frankfort, KY 40601, pursuant to KRS 61.880(2), or by filing an original action in Franklin Circuit Court under KRS 61.882. If you first appeal to the Attorney General but are dissatisfied with the Attorney General’s decision, you may further appeal to Circuit Court pursuant to KRS 61.880(5).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ileana Garnand Pursuant to KRS 61.872(5), the records you have requested are still not readily available because the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services is having to manually search its files and records database for responsive records. The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services is still searching for responsive records and working to compile the records to fulfill the request. The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services will review any responsive records for compliance with the Kentucky Open Records Act. The task has become more time consuming than originally thought, and the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services will need until February 12, 2026, to respond to your request. For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Natalie Nelson 
Office of Legal Services (OLS) Information Regarding Your Right to Appeal 
If you wish to appeal this decision, you may do so by filing a complaint with the Office of the Attorney General, Open Records/Open Meetings, The Capitol, 700 Capitol Avenue, Suite 118, Frankfort, KY 40601, pursuant to KRS 61.880(2), or by filing an original action in Franklin Circuit Court under KRS 61.882. If you first appeal to the Attorney General but are dissatisfied with the Attorney General’s decision, you may further appeal to Circuit Court pursuant to KRS 61.880(5).

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Eaton County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Eaton County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Eaton County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Attached please find an invoice totaling $26.52 in response to your FOIA request. There are only two methods of payment available. You can mail a check or money order made payable to Eaton County and include the FOIA # 172-5529 to my attention at the address below. If you elect to pay in person, you can come to the Controller’s Office in the courthouse Monday through Thursday at the address below to pay for your FOIA request. Our office hours are 8:30am – 12:00pm and 1:00pm – 4:30 pm Monday – Thursday, closed to the public on Friday.

The County has thirty (30) business days, not to include weekends or holidays, to produce the records upon receipt of payment.  The County does not accept credit cards, on-line payments, or payments over the phone. No records will be released until after full payment has been received. The records will be emailed to the email address used to submit the request.

Note: If a check is returned for non-payment, an NSF fee of $50.00 will be charged each time that same item is presented for payment when an account lacks sufficient available funds, and it is returned unpaid as a result. Additionally,  future checks will not be accepted for payment, only cash or money order.

Thank you.

Grace Ramirez, FOIA Specialist
Controller’s Office
Eaton County Courthouse
1045 Independence Blvd.
Charlotte, MI 48813
Phone: 517.543.2287
Fax: 517.543.3331
[A close up of a logo  Description automatically generated]
